intro: Berkheya evansii, commonly known as the African dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow, dandelion-like flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in grasslands and rocky areas. Berkheya evansii is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
